questions.q: Which skin condition is most commonly associated with psoriatic arthritis?
questions.explanation: Plaque psoriasis is present in about 85% of patients who develop psoriatic arthritis

questions.q: What is the most common type of skin cancer?
questions.explanation: Basal cell carcinoma is the most common type of skin cancer, accounting for about 80% of all skin cancers

questions.q: The joint between the two pubic bones is called the:
questions.explanation: The joint between two pubic bones is called pubic symphysis

questions.q: The greatest diameter of the fetal head is:
questions.explanation: The biggest diameter of the fetal head is occipitomental

questions.q: Molding of the fetal head:
questions.B: Becomes progressively easier as gestational age increases
questions.D: Does NOT have time to occur in breech delivery
questions.E: Does not happen when the maternal pelvis is adequate
questions.explanation: Molding of the fetal head does not occur in breech delivery

questions.q: The main blood supply of the vulva is:
questions.explanation: The main blood supply of the vulva is the pudendal artery

questions.q: The following are typical in the female bony pelvis EXCEPT:
questions.A: Has a transverse diameter of the inlet greater than the antero-posterior diameter
questions.B: Has an obstetric conjugate of 11-12 cm
questions.D: Has an obtuse greater sciatic notch
questions.E: Has a pubic angle greater than 90 degrees
questions.explanation: Gynecoid is considered the most common female pelvis and it is round and open, not funnel-shaped

questions.q: Regarding fetal head, choose the CORRECT answer:
questions.A: Can be delivered vaginally in persistent occipito-mental presentation
questions.B: Will show Spalding's sign within 12 hours of intrauterine death
questions.C: Can be delivered vaginally in persistent brow presentation
questions.D: Is likely to be a vertex presentation when the head is deflexed
questions.E: Considered to be engaged when the biparietal diameter passes the level of the pelvic inlet

questions.q: The ovarian artery is a branch of:
questions.explanation: The ovarian artery is a branch of the abdominal aorta

questions.q: The normal lining of the fallopian tube is:
questions.explanation: The normal lining of the fallopian tube is columnar epithelium with cilia

questions.q: The cilia of the fallopian tube has the following function:
questions.A: Remove the zona pellucida which surrounds the ovum
questions.B: Transport the ovum towards the uterus
questions.C: Enhance the rapid division of the zygote
questions.D: Transport the ovum towards the peritoneal cavity
questions.E: Has a bactericidal function to prevent peritoneal infection
questions.explanation: The cilia of the fallopian tube is responsible for transporting the ovum towards the uterus

questions.q: What condition produces a macrocytic anemia?
questions.explanation: B12 and B9 deficiency can lead to a macrocytic anemia

questions.q: What is the upper gestational age limit for a pregnancy loss to be classified as a miscarriage?
Which of the following is a cause of polyhydramnios?
questions.explanation: Esophageal atresia prevents the fetus from swallowing amniotic fluid, leading to polyhydramnios

questions.q: What is the most common coagulopathy to cause heavy menstrual bleeding?
questions.explanation: Von Willebrandâ€™s disease is the most common coagulopathy in women

questions.q: What is the correct definition of a secondary postpartum hemorrhage?
questions.C: Bleeding from 24 hours after delivery to 6 weeks postpartum
questions.D: Bleeding from 24 hours after delivery to 12 weeks postpartum
questions.explanation: Secondary postpartum hemorrhage is defined as excessive vaginal bleeding in the period from 24 hours after delivery to 12 weeks postpartum

questions.q: What is administered to prevent rhesus maternal isoimmunization?
questions.explanation: Anti-D immunoglobulin is administered to prevent rhesus isoimmunization

questions.q: Which of the following features is most strongly associated with cord prolapse?
questions.explanation: Occlusion and arterial vasospasm of the cord lead to hypoxia and fetal distress, which often presents as fetal bradycardia

questions.q: Why are cervical polyps routinely removed, even if asymptomatic?
questions.C: To prevent the spread of polyps
questions.D: They have a small risk of malignant transformation
questions.explanation: The risk of malignant transformation is less than 0.5%

questions.q: Which of the following is not part of Bishop's score?
What is the most common site of ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation: The ampulla end of the fallopian tube is the most common site for ectopic pregnancy

questions.q: What structure is the fetal station measured in relation to?
questions.explanation: Fetal station is measured in relation to the ischial spine

questions.q: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to VBAC?
questions.explanation: Classical cesarean section is always an absolute contraindication for VBAC due to high risk of uterine rupture

questions.q: Acanthosis nigricans is a sign of PCOS, what is it?
questions.A: Tender red nodules that form in both shins
questions.D: Darkened, velvety hyperpigmentation of the skin
questions.explanation: Acanthosis nigricans is seen in PCOS

questions.q: Which of the following is a recognized risk factor for adenomyosis?
questions.explanation: Previous uterine surgery is a strong risk factor for adenomyosis

questions.q: How is oligohydramnios defined?
questions.explanation: Oligohydramnios refers to a low level of amniotic fluid during pregnancy. It is defined by an amniotic fluid index that is below the 5th centile for the gestational age

questions.q: Which of the following can occur as a consequence of fetal hyperinsulinemia?
questions.explanation: Due to the anabolic effect of insulin, we see macrosomia in fetuses exposed to a large amount of it

questions.q: Which of the following procedures is offered in a prolonged pregnancy?
questions.explanation: An induction of labor is offered first-line in a post-dates pregnancy. If the patient declines an induction, they should be offered twice-weekly monitoring
